TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant is a lawyer practising in GPE ( GPE ) . On DATE he filed a request with ORG ( Amt der Landesregierung ) requesting a declaration that he was not a member of the local ORG ( Tourismusverband ) . According to LAW Tourismusgesetz ) , the applicant had been considered to be a compulsory member of GPE and had therefore been obliged to pay an DATE contribution to that GPE . The applicant submitted in his request that , as a practising lawyer , he had no direct or indirect interests in GPE tourism .

On DATE , as ORG had not reacted to his request , the applicant filed an application for a transfer of jurisdiction ( PERSON ) with the appeal board established under LAW . On DATE the appeal board requested the applicant to supplement his request by stating for what reasons he considered that he had no interest whatsoever in GPE tourism . In his statement the applicant explained that most of his clients had nothing to do with the tourist industry .

On DATE the appeal board found that the applicant was a member of ORG . Referring to the case - law of ORG , according to which lawyers were deemed to benefit from tourists in certain regions because they created more business for them , the board found that the applicant had not shown that in his particular case he had not benefited at all from the tourism in the region .

On DATE the applicant filed a complaint with ORG claiming that the compulsory membership of ORG violated his right not to be member of an association , as guaranteed by LAW . On DATE ORG refused to deal with the complaint for lack of prospects of success and transferred the case to ORG . On DATE ORG requested the applicant to supplement his complaint . On CARDINAL DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings as the applicant had failed to comply with the court ’s request .

The Tyrol Regional Tourism Act provides for the establishment of local ORG with the statement that “ all entrepreneurs of a community form a GPE ” ( LAW CARDINAL ) . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL further provides that “ ORG are public law institutions ” . According to LAW of GPE , compulsory members of ORG are those entrepreneurs who are economically , directly or indirectly , interested in GPE tourism and who have a permanent establishment or place of business in the area of GPE . This compulsory membership starts with the taking up of a business according to LAW and ends with its termination ( LAW ) . ORG ( Amt der Landesregierung ) is competent to take a decision on the compulsory membership of an entrepreneur upon his request , that of the chairman ( PERSON ) of a ORG or ex officio ( LAW ) .

According to LAW members are liable to compulsory contributions , which are calculated on the basis of their taxable turnover . The amount of the contribution due is fixed by ORG on the basis of the member ’s turnover tax orders which are furnished by ORG . ( Sections CARDINAL and DATE ) . ORG , which collects the contributions , has to apply LAW ( LAW ) . Against contribution orders issued by ORG an appeal lies with an appeals board ( LAW ) , which is composed of civil servants from ORG , ORG , ORG and ORG .

The tasks of a ORG are the promotion of the interests of local tourism , inter alia , by developing forms of tourism linked to local specificity , by promoting the understanding of the economic importance of tourism , and by supporting and training the members of ORG ) .

Sections CARDINAL to CARDINAL provide for the control of ORG by ORG . ORG may , inter alia , request any information from GPE , inspect its files and accounts and send delegates to plenary sessions , to sessions of the supervisory board and to sessions of the management board LAW CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) . ORG may also quash any decision of GPE that is contrary to the law ( LAW ) .
